title: Best-selling magnetic dinosaur wallpaper wins top Etsy award
text:
From House Beautiful

London-based designer Sian Zeng’s best-selling magnetic dinosaur wallpaper has secured her the $15,000 grand prize in Etsy’s first-ever global Design Awards.

Teamed with an array of playful, moveable magnets, the magnetised wallpaper allows children and adults alike to bring their imaginations to life on the walls of their home. It's perfect for a child's bedroom or playroom.

With fairytale-inspired, hand-drawn illustrations, and an inventive magnetic lining, Sian’s dinosaur wallpaper wowed the celebrity panel of judges. Winners were chosen based on quality, creativity, utility, wow factor, personal story and branding.

'The magnetic Dino wallpaper by Sian Zeng stood out for me as a clear winner as it’s so original and imaginative,' said interior designer and fellow Etsy Design Awards judge, Sophie Robinson. 'It mixes surface pattern with play in a really clever way.'

The unique magnetic wallpaper is created in four stages. First you have to paste the magnet receptive liner to the wall, followed by the white lining paper, then the patterned wallpaper. Leave sufficient drying time between each stage and then finish up by sealing with varnish to protect your magnetic wallpaper.

'Our paper encourages people to tell their own stories,' Sian explains. 'I really want them to interact with the wall and see what they come up with.'

BUY NOW Magnetic Dino Wallpaper

Photo credit: Etsy More

Photo credit: Etsy More

Other category winners, with sellers from the US, Greece, and Israel, were:

• Creative Collaborations Winner: Custom mid-century doghouse by Alejandro and Sara Pijuán of Pijuán Design Workshop

• Festive Celebrations Winner: Papercut wedding vow art by Naomi Shiek of Woodland Papercuts

• Earth-Friendly Winner: Upcycled interchangeable sliders by Vicky Moudilou and Stam Guinis of Eating The Goober

• Signature Style Winner: ‘Rainbows and Butterflies’ coat by Molly Goodall of Little Goodall

• Inventive Decor Winner: ‘The Sling’ walnut and leather chair by Justin Nelson of Fernweh Woodworking

'The creative heart of Etsy has always been our community of the most talented craftspeople and curators and with these awards we set out to find and recognise the very best of Etsy,' said Etsy Trend Expert and Etsy Design Awards judge, Dayna Isom Johnson. 'The Etsies have brought to life not only our global sellers’ commitment to their passion but a new level of breathtaking ingenuity and design well beyond our wildest dreams.'
